title: Trump faces new charges in Mar-A-Lago classified documents case
description: Former President Trump is facing additional charges in the Mar-A-Lago classified documents case. Meanwhile, his attorneys met today with federal prosecutors as the grand jury investigates January 6th and efforts to overturn the 2020 election. NBC News’ Laura Jarrett and Jonathan Dienst report.

title: Trump faces additional charges in Mar-a-Lago documents case
description: The latest news from special counsel Jack Smith, who is investigating Donald Trump and the efforts to overturn the 2020 election.

title: Trump, De Oliveira and Nauta allegedly tried to delete video footage at Mar-a-lago
description: Former President Trump, Carlos De Oliveira along with Walt Nauta face new obstruction charges after allegations they attempted to delete surveillance footage at Mar-a-lago in the summer of 2022. NBC News' Tom Winter shares the latest.

title: Facebook users siloed to 'significant' echo chambers in 2020 run-up, vast open data study reveals
description: A landmark study of how Facebook shaped the news users saw in the run-up to the 2020 election has found the platform resulted in “significant ideological segregation” in regard to political news exposure.

title: Sen. Dianne Feinstein told to 'just say aye' in awkward Senate committee moment
description: Sen. Dianne Feinstein, D-Calif., appeared confused during a vote on Thursday and was told to "just say aye" by another Democrat.

title: Justice Department to investigate Memphis polices use of force and possible discriminatory policing
description: The Justice Department is investigating the city of Memphis and its police department for possible violations in its use of force, searches and arrests and whether it engaged in discriminatory policing.

title: 'No one hurt me': Arizona teen who surfaced in Montana years after she disappeared speaks out
description: An Arizona teenager who showed up at a Montana police station nearly four years after she disappeared told detectives in Glendale that no one had hurt her, according to footage released by authorities.

title: Biden announces actions aimed at helping protect workers affected by extreme heat
description: President Joe Biden will announce actions his administration is taking to try to protect workers and communities affected by extreme heat.

title: Are aliens real? People online don't seem to care either way
description: The news that the government may be in possession of “nonhuman” biological matter and UFOs was met with surprising apathy online.

title: DeSantis set to start using new fundraising vehicle as campaign faces staff cuts
description: Ron DeSantis’ campaign is rebooting a pair of fundraising vehicles that have sat dormant since he launched, as his operation faces a difficult early stretch.

title: Prince Harry's lawsuit against newspaper can go to trial on snooping claims, judge rules
description: Prince Harry’s lawsuit accusing the publisher of The Sun tabloid of unlawfully snooping on him can go to trial, but not on claims of phone hacking, a High Court judge ruled Thursday.

title: Lawyers for Trump told to expect an indictment in meeting with special counsel's office
description: Live blog

title: Online scams to beware of: Phishing, vague texts, more
description: More than 800,000 scams were reported to the FBI in 2022, and there’s a good chance someone you or someone you know has been targeted at some point. NBC’s Jacob Ward shares way to stay safe and recover if you fall victim.

title: July was so hot that scientists think it has already been the hottest month ever
description: Data shows global mean temperatures on Earth’s surface were just above 62.5 degrees F through Sunday, exceeding the previous high of 61.9 degrees from July 2019.

title: Sinéad O'Connor's death is not being treated as suspicious, British police say
description: Irish singer Sinéad O'Connor's death is not being treated as suspicious, London's Metropolitan Police said Thursday.

title: The fight over 'Cop City': Inside the protests against Atlanta's new police training center
description: “Cop City” is what opponents call a proposed $90 million police and fire training facility in Atlanta — a plan that has embroiled the city in protests and demonstrations for nearly two years, at one point with deadly consequences. NBC News’ Craig Melvin traveled to Atlanta to speak with city leaders supporting “Cop City” and the activists who are fighting against it, to learn about life on the front lines of this ongoing debate.

title: Number of migrant families with kids crossing U.S. border nearly triples in two months
description: The number of migrant families with children crossing the border has nearly tripled in the past two months, feeding concern about a potential uptick in overall migrant crossings.

title: Trump teams prepare for possible Thursday grand jury vote
description: The Trump legal and political teams are preparing for the possibility that the federal grand jury will vote on charges against the former president as early as Thursday, according to three sources familiar with the thinking of Donald Trump’s inner circle.

title: GOP congressman calls on Florida to 'correct' Black history standards on slavery
description: Rep. Byron Donalds of Florida on Wednesday called on the state Department of Education to "correct" its new standards for teaching Black history.

title: Travis King’s family expresses anguish and calls for his return from North Korea
description: Family members of Travis King, the U.S. solider who inexplicably crossed into North Korea, said Wednesday they're suffering every moment he remains away and pleaded with the U.S. government to do more to get him home.

title: McConnell fell recently at Washington, D.C., airport prior to Wednesday’s freeze-up
description: Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell tripped and fell while disembarking from a plane at Reagan National Airport earlier this month, according to two sources familiar with the incident.

title: Netherlands strikes first to go up 1-0 over U.S.
description: Latest news and live updates on the U.S. women’s national soccer team match against the Netherlands this evening as the Women’s World Cup continues.
